description: From Latin dissertus, past participle of disserere, from dis- + serere (“to join, connect”). Compare French disserter. See series.

verbs.description: dissert (third-person singular simple present disserts, present participle disserting, simple past and past participle disserted)

entries.meaning: To discourse or dispute; to discuss.
examples: This, we are persuaded, is the true key to the greater part of the peculiarities of the author before us; and though we have disserted upon it a little longer than was necessary, we really think it may enable our readers to comprehend him  […]
